Name: Head of a Ptolemaic king
Description: This attractive royal head of black diorite, of the so-called 'physcon' type, probably dates from the 3rd-2nd centuries BC. Although the iconography is typically Egyptian - the double crown, uraeus, and back pillar -, the head does exhibit a number of Greek influences. The swollen face of the pharaoh is characterised by pronounced eyelids and eyebrow arches, and a rather thin mouth. It is impossible to identify the king represented.
